summary: The document is an FBI record detailing Santo Trafficante Jr.'s activities in Cuba around 1959, including his temporary release from detention to attend his daughter's wedding at the Hotel Havana-Hilton. It notes the presence of notable figures from Havana's gambling casinos and organized crime at the wedding, and mentions Trafficante's anticipated deportation to the United States as per a Cuban Government gazette. The document underscores the FBI's surveillance of Trafficante, highlighting his role in organized crime.
key_findings: Santo Trafficante Jr. was temporarily released from Cuban police detention to attend his daughter's wedding at the Hotel Havana-Hilton.
The wedding was attended by employees of Havana's gambling casinos and notable organized crime figures.
Trafficante was expected to be deported to the United States following a decree published in the Cuban Government gazette.
The FBI's surveillance of Trafficante's activities and associations underscores his significance in organized crime.
